DOCNAME: CASE OF AVIS ENTERPRISES v. GREECE
TEXT: CARDINAL . NORP The applicant company owns QUANTITY . m plot of land on the island of GPE , a popular tourist destination in GPE .

On DATE , by decision no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL of the Prefect of the LOC islands , the ORG expropriated real estate covering a surface of QUANTITY m , with a view to installing floodlights for FAC . CARDINAL sq . m of the applicant company ’s land were expropriated .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG applied to ORG of the island of GPE for a provisional amount of compensation per square metre of land expropriated to be assessed . The applicant company was not summoned to appear and did not do so .
On DATE the court assessed the provisional amount of compensation .

On DATE the provisional compensation was paid to ORG , but the applicant company refused to accept it on the ground that it was substantially less than the value of the land that had been expropriated from it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company had applied to ORG of LOC for a final amount of compensation per square metre to be assessed . It had also sought special compensation for CARDINAL other parcels of its land that had not been expropriated , on the ground that their value had diminished as the expropriated part had divided the land in CARDINAL .
On DATE ORG assessed the final amount of compensation and special compensation for the CARDINAL unexpropriated parcels .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG appealed to ORG .

On DATE ORG upheld ORG judgment in so far as it had assessed the final amount of compensation and remitted the case to ORG to rule on the merits of the action brought by the applicant company on DATE .

On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant company ’s claim for special compensation in respect of CARDINAL of the CARDINAL unexpropriated parcels of land . The difference between the amount of compensation as provisionally assessed and as finally assessed by ORG was not at that time paid to the applicant company .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company applied to ORG of LOC for a declaration that the expropriation had been rescinded by operation of law as the final amount of compensation due had not been paid .
On DATE ORG dismissed that application as unfounded .

CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE the difference between the amount of compensation as provisionally assessed and the amount as finally assessed by ORG was paid to ORG . The applicant company , which has not yet accepted that sum , alleges that it was not at any stage advised that it had been deposited .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant company appealed to ORG against the judgment of DATE . It also sought an order that the ORG pay the costs of the proceedings .

On DATE ORG upheld the impugned judgment and dismissed the applicant company ’s appeal . It also held that the applicant company was to bear the costs . In the earlier stages of the proceedings , there had been a set - off between the parties in respect of costs , even though the applicant company had requested that the costs be borne by the ORG .
